Posts.Content: mimi1 wrote: Hi ladies, I haven't posted here in awhile but was diagnosed in December with DCIS, had lumpectomy 01/03, margins came back pos, went back to surgery for a redo lumpectomy 01/17, just had my fourth radiation tx today.  No side effects yet other than about 2-3 hours after my treatment this morning, I've been nauseated all evening.  I was under the understanding with radiation you wouldn't have nausea... has anyone else experienced this? Your input appreciated. Mimi Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nausea during radiation?? mimi1 lizzie5308

Posts.Content: mimi1 wrote: Hi ladies, glad I found this forum as I get more confused the more I try and research.  I had a mammo in 2003 that found a 4-5 mm nodule, then u/s that showed nothing suspicious, rec. recheck in 6 mth. (missed the 6 mth due to no ins.) In 2005 had mammo and again they called me in for u/s. Said I had "matted lymph nodes" in right br, should follow up in 6 mth. (again family issues didn't get back to follow up till last week)  These were palpable to me too.  Now just went Friday had exam, doc felt the nodes in right br said felt like either two nodules or two hard lymph nodes, sending me to breast specialist (waiting for appt) to get me into mammogram (long wait) so she felt like the specialist could get me in ASAP.  She asked me if I had noticed enlarged nodes over my right clavicle bone, told her no, but really didn't think about it much till afterwards when I noticed I do feel a small puffy area over my clavicle bone... anyone know why this would be linked or had the same experience?  Also... should I push for a lymph node biopsy  since this has been going on so long or be settled with the usual routine of mammo and ultrasound?   Thanks for any input. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Enlarged nodes mimi1 mimi1

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2007 03:18PM mimi1 wrote: Thanks Tender for your comments.  I'm 41 and live in East Tennessee near Gatlinburg, have two grown boys 19 and 21 and my husband and I do foster care for small children.  Thankfully, I do have insurance now.  For me right now waiting is the hardest part as I'm sure everyone on here can relate.  You try to fill your time and thoughts with other things but inevitably it's what's on your mind.  I'm a medical transcriptionist so I can't use work to not think about it.  I'm glad I found this site though and will keep reading and posting and will post when I have some results, whichever way it goes. Thanks, Mimi
Posts.Title: Enlarged nodes mimi1 mimi1
